name: Dumbbell Sumo Deadlift
how_to_perform:
1. Stand with your feet wider than shoulder-width apart, toes pointed slightly outward.
2. Place a dumbbell between your feet with the handle parallel to your body.
3. Bend at the hips and knees to lower your body, and grasp the dumbbell with both hands, maintaining a straight or slightly arched lower back.
4. Engage your core muscles, keeping your chest up and shoulders back.
5. Start the lift by pushing through your heels, extending your hips and knees simultaneously to stand up with the dumbbell.
6. As you lift, keep the dumbbell close to your body and squeeze your glutes at the top of the movement.
7. Reverse the movement by bending your hips and knees to lower the dumbbell back to the floor, ensuring you maintain a straight back throughout.
8. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, ensuring proper form is maintained throughout.
short_summary: The Dumbbell Sumo Deadlift is an effective lower body exercise that targets the glutes, quadriceps, and hamstrings using a wide stance.
